title: rustc suggests obviously-wrong fixes when AsRef/Cow is involved

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the [following code](https://play.integer32.com/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=7df9e0f25c435bb865ff2b9785948922), arrived at when transitioning from the commented-out String to the Cow:
```rust
use std::process::Command;
use std::borrow::Cow;

// fn cargo_args() -> Vec<String> { panic!() }
fn cargo_args() -> Vec<Cow<'static, str>> { panic!() }

fn main() {
    Command::new("").args(&cargo_args()[..]);
    panic!();
}
```

The current output is:
```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0277]: the trait bound `Cow<'_, str>: AsRef<OsStr>` is not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:8:27
  |
8 |     Command::new("").args(&cargo_args()[..]);
  |                           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |                           |
  |                           the trait `AsRef<OsStr>` is not implemented for `Cow<'_, str>`
  |                           help: consider adding dereference here: `&*cargo_args()[..]`
  |
  = help: the following implementations were found:
            <Cow<'_, OsStr> as AsRef<Path>>
            <Cow<'_, T> as AsRef<T>>
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `AsRef<OsStr>` for `&Cow<'_, str>`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

And so, following the suggested, obviously wrong, replacement, I get the following error:
```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0614]: type `[Cow<'static, str>]` cannot be dereferenced
 --> src/main.rs:8:28
  |
8 |     Command::new("").args(&*cargo_args()[..]);
  |                            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0614`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

Happens in current stable and nightly.
